help me add details this is for my notion journla entry, output only text/paragram form no fancy formatting, revise in proper english, add details, make it dramatic and stoic


Today is a good day although there will be a lot of tasks that will come to me and will be needing my attention, for today I must be productive and focus on work so that the workloads became less, It‚Äôs really quite overwhelming to see my work I mean I‚Äôm a pre-sales Solution Architect for AWS and Red Hat, I‚Äôm quite new to the cloud and everything, but I must remain my posture and not let all these excuses guide me throughout my decisions. I must be going right now. Help me God for all these I‚Äôve prayed now I ask for Guidance and strength

Today is a good day, though I know it will demand much from me. A heavy tide of tasks awaits‚Äîeach one calling for my full attention and discipline. The weight of responsibility can feel overwhelming at times, especially as I stand at the beginning of my journey as a pre-sales Solutions Architect for AWS and Red Hat. I am new to this world of cloud and enterprise technology, and the challenges often tower before me like great mountains yet to be climbed. Still, I cannot afford to falter. I cannot give in to excuses or let uncertainty dictate my choices. My duty is to remain steadfast, composed, and committed‚Äîto face the work before me with discipline and resolve, no matter how daunting. If I persist, the burdens of today will eventually lighten, and the path ahead will reveal itself with greater clarity. For now, I must go forth with courage, trusting in God to grant me guidance, strength, and the clarity of mind to endure and overcome.
Now today is just the continuation of all the days, currently I‚Äôm consolidating all my pending tasks and activities, prioritizing what is important, and trying to finish all these tasks

Now today is but a continuation of all the days that have come before it, a steady march forward in this journey I have chosen. At this moment, I find myself consolidating the weight of my pending tasks and scattered activities, gathering them together like loose fragments that must be shaped into order. I sift through what is urgent and what is merely noise, drawing clear lines of priority so that I may act with precision. The burden is not small, yet the path to relief lies only in persistence and discipline. I must confront each task one by one, with patience and resolve, until the mountain of work is reduced to dust. Today is not about haste, but about progress‚Äîmeasured, deliberate, and unwavering.

how about for today 08/21/2025
Today is kind a rest day for me while I prepare myself for the bigger fishes, I mean now I‚Äôm preparing for my RHCSA exam, learnings from office and processe, learning to be more proactive, learning basics of Pre Sales, and being a good IT, being great on devops and cloud specially my what‚Äôs on my job title which is AWS. There is no time to waste

Today feels like a quiet pause‚Äîa day of stillness before the storm of greater battles ahead. I call it a rest day, but in truth, it is preparation disguised as calm. The bigger challenges are waiting: the RHCSA exam looms on the horizon, and with it, the weight of expectations from work, the discipline to master processes, and the drive to sharpen my edge as a pre-sales professional. I am learning not just to react, but to anticipate‚Äîto become proactive in thought and action. I am building my foundations in IT, strengthening my grasp on DevOps, and deepening my knowledge of the cloud, especially in the realm I now stand for: AWS. These moments of preparation are sacred, for there is no time to waste. Every hour spent in growth today becomes a shield for tomorrow. I must remind myself: greatness is not given, it is built‚Äîday by day, choice by choice.
I must go and act rather than be acted upon, the world values hard work although you knew to work smart and find shortcuts nothing beats hardwork

I must go now and choose to act rather than be acted upon, for passivity has no place in the pursuit of purpose. The world admires brilliance and clever shortcuts, yet it is relentless hard work that stands the test of time. To work smart is wisdom, but to combine it with unwavering effort is power. Nothing can replace the discipline of showing up, of pushing forward when ease whispers in your ear to stop. The path ahead demands not only intellect but endurance, not only strategy but sweat. Today, I choose to move with intent‚Äîto create rather than wait, to forge my way rather than let the current decide my fate. Hard work is not just a means to an end‚Äîit is the fire that shapes character, the silent force that turns ambition into reality.

I need to really pass that RHCSA, be productive on work and finish a lot of tasks, be stoic, be kind to other people and God Centered. Today I need to accomplish what needs to be done. Because this is my duty and my responsibility, I must forge discipline in me and stop all the bad habits one at a time

I need to pass the RHCSA. That is non-negotiable. I must also be productive in my work, clear the tasks that weigh on me, and move with purpose. Today, I remind myself to be stoic in the face of stress, to remain kind to others, and above all, to keep God at the center of everything I do. There is work that must be done, and it is my duty‚Äîmy responsibility‚Äîto see it through. Discipline must not remain an idea; it must take root in me, forged through action and perseverance. The habits that weaken me, that steal my time and focus, must be broken‚Äîone at a time, day by day. Today is not for excuses. Today is for building the foundation of the person I strive to become.

In life there is only once chance, either you risk it long enought to be insane and be at the top or be the mediocre type of guy who just always thinks of what if. In life there are only two sides, the winners and the one who take risks and failed but keep on going, there is no losing, there is no giving up, the more you try, the more you learn, and the more you learn the better the odds of winning in life so keep on dreaming, keep on trying John, soon you‚Äôll be all the things you‚Äôve dreamt of years ago, have you ever noticed John that you‚Äôre becomeing what you are longing? Just think of it for a second

In life, there is only one chance‚Äîone brief window to shape the story you will leave behind. You either risk it all, long enough to seem insane, and rise to the top, or you settle into the comfort of mediocrity, forever haunted by the whisper of what if. There are only two kinds of people: those who win, and those who dare greatly, fail, and rise again. There is no true losing unless you choose to stop. There is no surrender unless you lay down your will. Every attempt, every stumble, every hardship is a lesson‚Äîand with every lesson, your odds of victory grow stronger.


So keep dreaming, John. Keep trying. Soon enough, you will stand in the reality of the things you once imagined, the very dreams that felt so distant years ago. Have you noticed, John, that you are already becoming what you once longed to be? Think about it for a second. The path is unfolding. The man you dreamed of‚Äîthat man is forming within you, one choice at a time.

Today, September 4, 2025, I can truly say there has been so much progress‚Äîespecially in my professional life. I‚Äôve been actively monitoring and following up on all the accounts under my care, pushing forward with consistency and discipline. Hopefully, by the end of today, I can clear out all the pending items that have been weighing on me. For now, I feel good‚ÄîI feel steady.


I thank God for guiding me through this journey, for giving me the strength to endure and the wisdom to move forward. And I thank myself for refusing to give up, even when the road felt heavy. I know there will be harder days ahead, more battles that will test my patience and resolve, but I must always remember this truth: these challenges are not punishments‚Äîthey are lessons, tests placed by God to shape me into someone greater. And so, I will carry on.

how about for a new day


Literally got sick yesterday and needed to rest. Although I have tons of stuff to do for the next days, it seems I‚Äôm getting more comfortable on work each day, the only problem I have is sometimes I get quite lazy in learning on the technical side for IT, AWS, and RHEL, that should I be working on and keep on learning, for now we have two priorities:


Pass the RHCSA

Pass the AWS AI/ML course

Yesterday, I was forced to slow down‚Äîmy body demanded rest, and I had no choice but to listen. Now, a new day begins, and though the tasks ahead are many, I feel a sense of growing familiarity with the rhythm of my work. Each day, I become more comfortable in my role, more grounded in the path I‚Äôve chosen. Yet I cannot ignore the truth: there are moments when laziness creeps in, moments when I falter in my commitment to learning the technical foundations that truly matter‚ÄîIT, AWS, and RHEL. These are the pillars of my craft, and I must not take them lightly.


For now, my focus must sharpen to two clear priorities:


To pass the RHCSA

To complete the AWS AI/ML course


These are not just tasks on a list‚Äîthey are stepping stones to the future I envision. Discipline will be my weapon. Consistency will be my shield. Today, I rise to face the work with renewed resolve.

Day by day I feel so drained in my Job, I really don‚Äôt know where I‚Äôm going, what I‚Äôm thinking is I just want this to end I mean to go home and end the shift, maybe i‚Äôm tired, maybe I‚Äôm just overthinking things but nevertheless I should keep moving forward and move on

Day by day, I feel the weight of exhaustion pressing heavier on me. My job drains me in ways I cannot always explain, and at times I find myself questioning where I am going, what path I am truly on. There are moments when all I want is for the day to end, to go home, to close my eyes, and let the noise of work fall silent. Maybe it is fatigue. Maybe it is just my thoughts running too deep, turning small struggles into heavy burdens.


But even in this state, I know one thing remains true: I must keep moving forward. To stop now would be to abandon the very growth I‚Äôve been fighting for. Weariness will pass, confusion will fade, but perseverance will remain. So I remind myself‚Äîmove on, step by step, even when it feels heavy. Because forward is the only direction worth taking.

You only live once you why bother other people‚Äôs opinion. In life there are only two options either you go up or you go down, it‚Äôs much better to see progress rather than full time bulshit

You only live once, so why waste energy worrying about the opinions of others? In life, there are only two directions‚Äîyou either rise or you fall. As I face these struggles day by day, exhaustion seeps deeper into me. The harder I try, the more demanding the path becomes; the further I push forward, the greater the obstacles rise before me. Yet I know that only those who possess courage, strength, and unwavering heart are truly worthy of the prize that lies ahead. Not gonna lie, today‚Äôs the day I feel like I‚Äôm more becoming productive day by day, for the past couple of hours I‚Äôve done hard tasks that I feel like I should be proud of, today I just need to continue that streak

Not gonna lie, today feels like one of those rare days where I can truly see myself growing more productive with each passing moment. Although times are tough, there will always be hope, do not lose hope, hope is all you can give in times of despair, do not put out that fire in your heart. lately I have been thinking long term in terms of my professional career if I should keep going or let go, I will decide that 1 year from now. honestly I‚Äôm not quite enjoying my work although my peers and coworkers are alright. Maybe the problem is me? I really don‚Äôt know, for now I should still keep growing, and adapt to my environment

Although times are tough, there will always be hope. Do not let it slip away, for hope is often the only light we can offer ourselves in moments of despair. Never extinguish that fire within your heart‚Äîit is what keeps you moving forward when everything else feels uncertain.


Lately, I‚Äôve been thinking deeply about the long term, questioning the direction of my professional career. Should I keep going, or should I eventually let go? I‚Äôve decided that one year from now, I will make that choice with a clearer mind and a stronger sense of purpose. To be honest, I‚Äôm not truly enjoying my work right now. My peers and coworkers are good, supportive even, but something still feels off. Maybe the problem lies within me‚ÄîI‚Äôm not sure.


But one thing I do know: for now, I must continue to grow. I must adapt, evolve, and learn to thrive in the environment I‚Äôm in. The answers will come with time, but giving up is not one of them.

Just want to say I‚Äôm just thankful for today, I have nothing much to say rather than being thankful for what I have, what  I‚Äôve done, what will happen as God graced me with a lot of of blessings lately. Thanks Lord

2/2

For today, my tasks are simple yet important: update the pipeline, push progress across all my assigned accounts as much as I can, and dedicate time to studying for both the GitHub Copilot and RHEL exams. That‚Äôs the plan‚Äîsteady, focused, and purposeful.


On another note, I can‚Äôt help but feel uneasy about what‚Äôs been happening lately. After the massive earthquake in Cebu that claimed more than 70 lives, now Davao Oriental has been struck by another powerful quake just a week or two later. It‚Äôs alarming, and it makes me wonder about the possibility of the ‚ÄúBig One‚Äù finally hitting Metro Manila. The thought alone is terrifying‚Äîsuch an event would be devastating beyond measure. I can only hope and pray that when that time comes, we will all be ready, both physically and spiritually. May God protect us all.

I gonna say that I really enjoyed and grateful for October 14, 2025 although everything I did was hard, time consuming, and drains my physical and mental health - all I gotta say that everything is worth it.


John you should realize that everyday is an opportunity to grow in many way, so use this time you have efficiently and try to come up with ideas or things that could benefit the future you :)

I‚Äôve got to say, I‚Äôm truly grateful for October 14, 2025. It was a long, demanding day‚Äîeverything I did required effort, time, and a lot of mental and physical energy. Yet, despite the exhaustion, I can confidently say it was all worth it. Every challenge, every moment of struggle, added something valuable to my growth.


John, you have to remember this: each day is an opportunity to grow‚Äîin skill, in discipline, and in character. Time is fleeting, and how you use it defines who you become. So use it wisely. Keep creating, keep thinking, and keep building ideas that will serve the future version of yourself. Every small effort today is an investment in the person you‚Äôre meant to be.

Throughout the years I‚Äôve been trying to be the best at what I do, the problem is that this is very exhausting. Recently I realize the value of consistency rather than give our you entire energy and run you out for the week, you see people tend to incline on things that are easy and things that are difficult. So yeah for now John you should practice this art of consistency and try to be more enthusiastic about it, convince your brain to do the hard stuff that would benefit you on the long run

Throughout the years, I‚Äôve been striving to be the best at what I do‚Äîbut I‚Äôve come to realize how exhausting that pursuit can be. Perfection demands everything, and if you‚Äôre not careful, it drains you before you even reach halfway. Lately, I‚Äôve begun to understand the deeper value of consistency. It‚Äôs not about giving your full energy in one burst and burning out for the rest of the week; it‚Äôs about showing up steadily, doing what needs to be done day after day, even when it‚Äôs hard or uninspiring.


People naturally gravitate toward comfort‚Äîthey chase what‚Äôs easy and avoid what‚Äôs difficult. But real growth lies in the hard stuff, the things that test your will and stretch your limits. So, John, remember this: practice the art of consistency. Be patient with your progress, and learn to find meaning in repetition. Train your mind to embrace the grind, to love the process, because the small, deliberate efforts you make each day will shape the person you‚Äôre destined to become.

It‚Äôs really quite inspiring when you see someone trying his hardest and all of his/her best effort to persuade somehting, I hope in the few month to year I‚Äôll be delusional and obssessed to be the best version of myself

It‚Äôs truly inspiring to witness someone giving their all‚Äîpouring every ounce of effort, energy, and heart into something they believe in. There‚Äôs a certain beauty in that kind of determination, in seeing someone refuse to settle for mediocrity. I hope that in the months and years ahead, I can embody that same fire‚Äîto become so focused, so driven, that it borders on delusion and obsession. Not the kind that blinds, but the kind that fuels. I want to be consumed by the vision of becoming the best version of myself‚Äîrelentless, disciplined, and unwavering in purpose.

I gotta admit that I‚Äôm not perfect ,we make mistakes and I‚Äôm a human, but does it count as a pass on every situation, certainly not, we humans are easily manipulated, fooled and addicted to different things that are harmful to use, the only way to remove these addictions is consistency and trying to resist the urge to do that again, once mastered you can master you whole life

I‚Äôve got to admit‚ÄîI‚Äôm not perfect. None of us are. We make mistakes because we‚Äôre human, and that‚Äôs part of our nature. But that doesn‚Äôt mean our flaws give us a free pass in every situation. We are easily swayed, deceived, and drawn toward things that harm us‚Äîhabits, distractions, and addictions that slowly consume our time and strength.


The only real way to break free from these cycles is through consistency‚Äîthrough the discipline of resisting those urges, day after day, until they lose their power. It‚Äôs never easy, but once you learn to master your impulses, you begin to master your life. True control doesn‚Äôt come from perfection‚Äîit comes from awareness, restraint, and the quiet persistence to do better every single day.

Yesterday was fun. I met the girl from Twitter who ghosted me for months ‚Äî and honestly, I didn‚Äôt expect her to reach out again. Seeing her in person left me amazed; her looks, her presence‚Ä¶ damn, that moment is something I won‚Äôt forget anytime soon.

Here‚Äôs a focused, realistic plan you can follow today given your one-week timeline before RHCSA:



Today‚Äôs Focus: One Week Before RHCSA


You have two priorities running in parallel:


RHCSA review (non-negotiable)

Presales pipeline clean-up and follow-ups


You don‚Äôt need to overcomplicate today. You just need movement.



1. RHCSA (Main Priority)


Since you only have about a week left, the rule is:


Do one major RHCSA topic today.


Pick one from this list:


Users & groups

File permissions

SELinux basics

Systemd services

Networking (nmcli)

Storage (LVM, partitions)

Containers (podman)

System troubleshooting


Finish one topic completely, with hands-on practice.



2. Work Tasks (Presales)


These are lighter and can be done in between RHCSA sessions:


a. Mass-update inquiries to AMs


Send short, professional messages:

Hi , just following up if there are any updates on . Let me know if I need to prepare anything on the technical side.

Keep it short so you can send to multiple AMs in minutes.


b. Clean pipeline


Remove stale entries

Move on-hold items properly

Update notes with last touch date

Tag opportunities needing AM confirmation


c. Revisit forgotten accounts


Check:


Old scoping calls

Clients with pending technical inputs

Accounts where AM has not responded

Ones with potential this Q4


Your goal isn‚Äôt to finish everything‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs to enter the week with your pipeline organized and your RHCSA path clean.



Mindset for Today


You don‚Äôt need motivation‚Äîjust momentum.
One week is enough IF you focus.
Keep your energy small but consistent.
Don‚Äôt burn out today. Just progress.



If you want, I can create a 7-day RHCSA final sprint plan tailored to your weak areas.
